result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario A Sotelo Ocampo

records.addlTxt: No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container.  Defendant to have identification on him at all times.

1:08 PM Defendant Mario A Sotelo Ocampo appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court for Mario A Sotelo Ocampo.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Attorney Joyce advises Defendant was mistaken on time of last date and turned self in on warrant. Discussion on bail. Court reinstates bail. Counsel waives time limits and requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Per Dispatch, subject in custody on warrant

Adjustment Number: 22A 151176,
Payable Number: 142524,
Receipt Number: 22R 010697,
Amount: $20.00
Copy of warrant emailed to Sheriffnotice
9:05 AM Defendant Mario A Sotelo Ocampo not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court forfeits bail and issues warrant.

No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container.  Defendant to have identification on him at all times.

9:13 AM Defendant Mario A Sotelo Ocampo in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of penalties and finds probable cause. Copy of complaint provided to defendant. Defendant will hire an attorney. Defendant currently serving a sentence until 10/6/22 and has work release. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. State requesting $500 signature bond with conditions.
Status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

(8:08 am) Def called COC's Office indicating will be late, arriving at 8:30 am.  Defendant indicates does not have counsel.
